page.title: 04Thorney Fire Service
page.content: {Thorney Fire Station}was built around{1968.}Two firemen every year paint the rooms and ceilings.The Fire Station consists of a small{kitchen,2 {toilets}(male and female),and a{bar} for meetings,clubs,etc. It also has a {lecture room,}a{muster bay,}a{watch {room,}and the{pump bay}to keep the appliance in. Outside there is an open space for cars, a{tower}for practising ladder work, bike slots,and a lawn. There are 13 men who work as firemen. Every now and again the fire engine has to be overhauled, and another engine is brought from {Peterborough.}All the firemen are {retained firemen,}who have other full-time jobs. Each man recieves a call by means of an{alerter}which they have near them at all times. It has a red light and a bleeping sound which goes off when there's a call.
